feature.name: Ahmad
feature.origin: Youngest son; brings father a magic apple; marries the Genie Peri Banu.

feature.name: Ajib
feature.origin: Brother of Gharib in the tale "The History of Gharib and His Brother Ajib."

feature.name: Aladdin
feature.origin: Hero of the tale; he has the magic lamp.

feature.name: Al-Bakbuk
feature.origin: The barber's first brother in "The Hunchback’s Tale."

feature.name: Alexandria Sulcus
feature.origin: City in the tale "The Sharper of Alexandria and the Chief of Police" from Richard F. Burton's Arabian Nights.

feature.name: Al-Fakik
feature.origin: The barber's third brother in "The Hunchback’s Tale."

feature.name: Al-Haddar
feature.origin: The barber's second brother in "The Hunchback’s Tale."

feature.name: Ali Baba
feature.origin: Hero of tale who found a great treasure owned by 40 thieves.

feature.name: Al-Kuz
feature.origin: The barber’s fourth brother in “The Hunchback’s Tale.”

feature.name: Al-Medinah Sulci
feature.origin: Place in the tale "The Lovers of Al-Medinah."

feature.name: Al-Mustazi
feature.origin: Father of benevolent prince Al-Mustansir in "The Hunchback’s Tale."

feature.name: Al-Yaman Sulci
feature.origin: Place in the tale "The Man of Al-Yaman and His Six Slave-Girls."

feature.name: Anbar Fossae
feature.origin: City in the tale "The Prior who became a Moslem."

feature.name: Andalús Sulci
feature.origin: City in the tale "The Merchant’s Daughter and the Prince Al-Irak."

feature.name: Ayyub
feature.origin: Damascus merchant, father of Ghanim and Fitnah in the "Tale of Ghanim Bin Ayyub, the Distraught, the Thrall O’ Love."

feature.name: Aziz
feature.origin: Man betrothed to his cousin Azizah in "The tale of Aziz and Azizah."

feature.name: Baghdad Sulcus
feature.origin: City where the hunchback did his tailoring in "The Hunchback’s Tale" from Richard F. Burton's Arabian Nights.

feature.name: Bahman
feature.origin: Oldest Prince, brother of Parwez and Perizadah in the tale "The Two Sisters Who Envied Their Cadette."

feature.name: Bassorah Fossa
feature.origin: Town from which Sindbad embarked on his 3rd voyage.

feature.name: Behram
feature.origin: Son of a Persian king in the tale "Prince Behram and the Princess Al-Datma."

feature.name: Bishangarh Fossae
feature.origin: Place in the tale "Prince Ahmad and the Fairy Peri Banu."

feature.name: Bulak Sulcus
feature.origin: Place in the tale "Story of the Chief of the Bulak Police."

feature.name: Cairo Sulcus
feature.origin: City in the "Tale of Nur Al-Din Ali and his son Badr Al-Din Hassan."

feature.name: Camphor Sulcus
feature.origin: Islands in the "Tale of Aziz and Azizah."

feature.name: Cashmere Sulci
feature.origin: City in "The Goldsmith and the Cashmere Singing Girl."

feature.name: Cufa Dorsa
feature.origin: City in the "Tale of Kamar Al-Zaman."

feature.name: Dalilah
feature.origin: Crafty old crone who fools several men.

feature.name: Damascus Sulcus
feature.origin: Home city of the merchant Ayyub, father of Ghanim and Fitnah in the "Tale of Ghanim Bin Ayyub, the Distraught, the Thrall O’ Love."

feature.name: Daryabar Fossa
feature.origin: "Ocean region"; land from which Princess Daryabar came.

feature.name: Diyar Planitia
feature.origin: Country where Khudadad's father ruled.

feature.name: Duban
feature.origin: Sage who cured King Yunan of leprosy.

feature.name: Dunyazad
feature.origin: Sister of Shahrazad.

feature.name: Ebony Dorsum
feature.origin: City in the "Tale of Kamar Al-Zaman."

feature.name: Fitnah
feature.origin: Daughter of Ayyub, sister of Ghanim in the "Tale of Ghanim Bin Ayyub, the Distraught, the Thrall O’ Love."

feature.name: Ghanim
feature.origin: Son of Ayyub, brother of Fitnah in the "Tale of Ghanim Bin Ayyub, the Distraught, the Thrall O’Love."

feature.name: Gharib
feature.origin: Hero of many tales.

feature.name: Hamah Sulci
feature.origin: City in the tale "The Man's Dispute with the Learned Woman of the Relative Excellence of the Male and Female."

feature.name: Harran Sulci
feature.origin: City where Khudadad's father ruled.

feature.name: Harun
feature.origin: Harun al-Rashid; Caliph in many tales, for example "Harun Al-Rashid and the Two Slave-Girls."

feature.name: Hassan
feature.origin: Character in the tale "Hassan of Bassorah."

feature.name: Hisham
feature.origin: Caliph in the tale "The Caliph Hisham and the Arab Youth."

feature.name: Isbanir Fossa
feature.origin: Fakir Taj's home; may be ancient Ctesiphon.

feature.name: Ishak
feature.origin: Character in the tale "Isaac of Mosul and the Merchant."

feature.name: Ja’afar
feature.origin: Vizier of Harun al-Rashid in the tale "Nur al-Din Ali and the Damsel Anis al-Jalis."

feature.name: Jansha
feature.origin: Female hero in "The Story of Jansha."

feature.name: Julnar
feature.origin: The seaborn; heroine of nights 738 to 756.

feature.name: Kamar
feature.origin: Kamar al-Akmár; Prince, son of Sabur (King of Persia) in the tale "The Ebony Horse."

feature.name: Kasim
feature.origin: The greedy brother of Ali Baba in the tale "Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves."

feature.name: Kaukabán Fossae
feature.origin: Place in the tale "How Abu Hasan Brake Wind."

feature.name: Khorasan Fossa
feature.origin: Place (province) in the tale "Ali Shar and Zumurrud."

feature.name: Khusrau
feature.origin: King, husband of Shirin in the tale "Khusrau and Shirin and the Fisherman."

feature.name: Labtayt Sulci
feature.origin: Royal city, site of a tower locked by kings in the tale "The City of Labtayt."

feature.name: Láhej Sulci
feature.origin: City in the tale “How Abu Hasan brake wind.”

feature.name: Ma’aruf
feature.origin: Hero in the tale "Ma'aruf the Cobbler and His Wife Fatimah."

feature.name: Makran Sulci
feature.origin: Land in the tale "The Tale of Salim, the Youth of Khorasan, and Salma, his Sister."

feature.name: Marjanah
feature.origin: Queen in the "Tale of Kamar Al-Zaman."

feature.name: Masrur
feature.origin: Eunuch sworder in the tale "Nur al-Din Ali and the Damsel Anis al-Jalis."

feature.name: Misr Sulci
feature.origin: City in the tale "History of Al-Hajjaj Bin Yusuf and the Young Sayyid."

feature.name: Morgiana
feature.origin: Clever slave girl in the tale "Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves."

feature.name: Mosul Sulci
feature.origin: City where Isaac was pulled up in a basket to a mansion and four damsels in the tale “Isaac of Mosul.”

feature.name: Musa
feature.origin: Goes to get the vessels that contain Jinni in "The City of Brass".

feature.name: Mustafa
feature.origin: Old tailor in the tale "Aladdin; or The Wonderful Lamp."

feature.name: Omar
feature.origin: Great king, father of Sharrkan and Zau al-Makán in "The Tale of King Omar and his Sons."

feature.name: Otbah
feature.origin: Figure in the tale "Otbah and Rayya."

feature.name: Parwez
feature.origin: Second prince, brother of Bahman and Perizadah in the tale "The Two Sisters Who Envied Their Cadette."

feature.name: Peri-Banu
feature.origin: Genie who marries Ahmad and helps him fulfill the demands of his father.

feature.name: Perizadah
feature.origin: Youngest princess, sister of Bahman and Parwez in the tale "The Two Sisters Who Envied Their Cadette."

feature.name: Rayya
feature.origin: Female character in the tale "Otbah and Rayya."

feature.name: Sabur
feature.origin: King of Persia and father of Kamar in the tale "The Ebony Horse."

feature.name: Salih
feature.origin: Brother of Julnar.

feature.name: Samad
feature.origin: Shayk who guides Musa and Talib to the mountains in "The City of Brass".

feature.name: [Samaria Fossa]
feature.origin: Place in the tale “Khudadad and His Brothers.”

feature.name: Samaria Rupes
feature.origin: Place in the tale "Khudadad and His Brothers."

feature.name: Samarkand Sulci
feature.origin: Country ruled over by Zaman, brother of Shahryar.

feature.name: Sarandib Planitia
feature.origin: Ceylon (Sri Lanka); the island visited by Sindbad on his 6th voyage.

feature.name: Shahrazad
feature.origin: Heroine who tells King Shahryar "The Tales of a Thousand Nights".

feature.name: Shahryar
feature.origin: King whom Shahrazad beguiles with the tales of a thousand nights and a night.

feature.name: Shakashik
feature.origin: The barber's sixth brother in "The Hunchback’s Tale."

feature.name: Sharrkan
feature.origin: Son of the great King Omar in "The Tale of King Omar and his Sons."

feature.name: Shiraz Sulcus
feature.origin: Place in "Prince Ahmad and the Fairy Peri Banu."

feature.name: Shirin
feature.origin: Wife of King Khusrau in the tale "Khusrau and Shirin and the Fisherman."

feature.name: Sindbad
feature.origin: Voyager who had many marvelous adventures on seven voyages.

feature.name: Sind Sulci
feature.origin: City in the tale "The Merchant’s Daughter and the Prince of Al-Irak."

feature.name: Yunan
feature.origin: Fictional king of Persian city in the tale "The Tale of the Vizier and the Sage Duban."

feature.name: Zaynab
feature.origin: Daughter of Dalilah in the tale "The Rogueries of Dalilah the Crafty and Her Daughter Zaynab the Coney-Catcher."

feature.name: Zumurrud
feature.origin: Female character in the tale "Ali Shar and Zumurrud."
